process for the next CO 2 photoreduction test.The results showed that the CH 4 and CH 3 OH yields were decreased slightly after a fourth cyclic test, indicating that the synthesized BC2 composite possessed satisfactory stability properties. The light response capacity of all catalysts was investigated via UV-vis absorption spectroscopy, as displayed in Fig. 7(a).Among all catalysts, the CuO catalyst alone exhibited the strongest light response capacity, while the BiOCl catalyst alone displayed the weakest

harvesting light and promoting the segregation and transfer efficiency of the photogenerated carriers.Furthermore, the greater number of generated electrons could enhance the activation of CO 2 , which could decrease the energy barriers of the thermodynamically stable CO 2 and especially promote the formation of CO 2 -reduced intermediates (HCOOH, HCO 3 -).As a result, the CO 2 photoreduction performance of the electron-induced heterostructure of CuOBiOCl composites exhibited higher CH 4 and CH 3 OH yields

higher CH 4 and CH 3 OH yields than neat CuO or BiOCl, in which the optimized BC2 photocatalyst (2 mass ratio of CuO to BiOCl) reached 114.1 molh -1 g -1 CH 4 and 36.2 molh -1 g -1 CH 3 OH.This work provided a new strategy to synthesize efficient heterojunctions that can improve the photocatalytic reduction of CO 2 ; these heterojunctions were constructed with a strong interaction interface via self-electron-reduction.

transfer that occurred on the heterostructured interface.The selectivity of the two products over all catalysts was calculated, as shown in Fig. 6 (b).The selectivity of CH 4 over all catalysts was approximately 80, indicating that the formation of a heterostructure had little influence on the selectivity.In addition, the obviously different boiling points of CH 4 and CH 3 OH enabled their easier separation.Due to the observation of Cu 2 O in the composite, the role of Cu 2 O played in the photoreduction

Please find the category of Light_source and Lamp from the provided context which describe an solar chemical experiment.
The generation condition of the extraction is given: If Light_source is Solar or Solar Simulator, Lamp is always Solar Simulator.

alone displayed the weakest light response capacity.The three composites had a similar light response. higher CH 4 and CH 3 OH yields than neat CuO or BiOCl, in which the optimized BC2 photocatalyst (2 mass ratio of CuO to BiOCl) reached 114.1 molh -1 g -1 CH 4 and 36.2 molh -1 g -1 CH 3 OH.This work provided a new strategy to synthesize efficient heterojunctions that can improve the photocatalytic reduction of CO 2 ; these heterojunctions were constructed with a strong interaction interface via self-electron-reduction.
